member.name: T:Mercurial.ICommand
member.summary: This interface must be implemented by all classes that implement the command pattern for executing Mercurial and TortoiseHg commands.

member.name: M:Mercurial.ICommand.Validate
member.summary: Validates the command configuration. This method should throw the necessary exceptions to signal missing or incorrect configuration (like attempting to add files to the repository without specifying which files to add.)

member.name: M:Mercurial.ICommand.Before
member.summary: This method is called before the command is executed. You can use this to store temporary files (like a commit message or similar) that the refer to, before the command is executed.

member.name: M:Mercurial.ICommand.After(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is called after the command has been executed. You can use this to clean up after the command execution (like removing temporary files), and to react to the exit code from the command line client. If the exit code is considered a failure, this method should throw the correct exception.
member.param: The exit code from the command line client. Typically 0 means success, but this can vary from command to command.
The standard output of the execution, or if there was none.
The standard error output of the execution, or if there was none.
member.remarks: Also note that if the command exit code is considered a success, this method should parse the output and prepare any results based on it.

member.name: P:Mercurial.ICommand.Command
member.summary: Gets the command to execute with the Mercurial command line client.

member.name: P:Mercurial.ICommand.Arguments
member.summary: Gets all the arguments to the , or an empty array if there are none.

member.name: P:Mercurial.ICommand.AdditionalArguments
member.summary: Gets any additional arguments to the , or an empty collection if there are none.

member.name: P:Mercurial.ICommand.Observer
member.summary: Gets the that will be informed of execution progress. Can be null in case there is no observer.

member.name: P:Mercurial.ICommand.Timeout
member.summary: Gets the timeout in seconds for how long to wait for the command to complete successfully before terminating it and throwing an exception. A typical default value is 60.

member.name: P:Mercurial.CommandBase`1.AdditionalArguments
member.summary: Gets the collection which additional arguments can be added into. This collection is exposed for extensions, so that they have a place to add all their extra arguments to the Mercurial command line client.
member.remarks: Note that all of these arguments will be appended to the end of the command line, after all the normal arguments supported by the command classes.

member.name: P:Mercurial.CommandBase`1.Command
member.summary: Gets the command to execute with the Mercurial command line client.
member.remarks: Note that this property is required to return a non-null non-empty (including whitespace) string, as it will be used to specify which command to execute for the Mercurial command line client. You're not required to call the base property though, as long as you descend from .

member.name: P:Mercurial.CommandBase`1.Arguments
member.summary: Gets all the arguments to the , or an empty array if there are none.
member.remarks: Note that as long as you descend from you're not required to access the base property at all, but you are required to return a non-null array reference, even for an empty array.

member.name: P:Mercurial.CommandBase`1.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout to use when executing Mercurial commands, in seconds. Default is 60.

member.name: T:Mercurial.BisectCommand
member.summary: This class implements the "hg bisect" command (): subdivision search of changesets.

remarks.para: The should be used by first updating the repository to a changeset where the current state is known to be bad or good, and then updated to another changeset were the current state is known to be the opposite of the previous changeset. Then the should be iteratively executed, analyzing the property each time.

When the object in that property says = false, then the repository has been updated to a new changeset. The program should then analyze the changeset and determine if its state is good or bad, and issue another to that effect.
When the says that = true, the property contains the revspec of the first changeset that is deemed good or bad, depending on what you're looking for.

member.name: T:Mercurial.BookmarkCommand
member.summary: This class implements the "hg bookmark" command (): track of a line of development with movable markers.
member.remarks: Note that in Mercurial, the "bookmark" and "bookmarks" commands are synonyms for each other, which means that in Mercurial, to get a list of bookmarks, you execute either without arguments, and to create a new bookmark you execute either with a name argument. In Mercurial.Net I decided to split these two into separate commands, so that the lists existing bookmarks, and the creates or deletes bookmarks.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.Revisions
member.summary: Gets the collection of revisions to be added to the destination, and thus include in the bundle. If empty, include every changeset from the source repository that isn't in the destination. Default is empty.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.Branches
member.summary: Gets the collection of branches to bundle. Default is empty.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.BaseRevisions
member.summary: Gets the collection of revisions assumed to be available at the destination, and thus not included in the bundle. Mostly used when leaving empty, to calculate an "assumed" bundle for a target repository that may not be available for comparison. Default is empty.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.All
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to bundle all the changesets in the repository. Default is false.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression type to use for the bundle file. Default is MercurialCompressionType.BZip2.

member.name: P:Mercurial.BundleCommand.FileName

member.name: T:Mercurial.Hooks.MercurialControllingHookBase

member.summary: Terminates the hook program and allows the Mercurial command being hooked to proceed as normal.

member.summary: Terminates the hook and cancels the Mercurial command being executed.

member.name: T:Mercurial.MergeTools
member.summary: This class holds string constants with proper .NET identifiers for the built-in known merge tools.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalMerge
member.summary: Uses the internal non-interactive simple merge algorithm for merging files. It will fail if there are any conflicts and leave markers in the partially merged file.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalFail
member.summary: Rather than attempting to merge files that were modified on both branches, it marks them as unresolved. The resolve command must be used to resolve these conflicts.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalLocal
member.summary: Uses the local version of files as the merged version.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalOther
member.summary: Uses the other version of files as the merged version.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalPrompt
member.summary: Asks the user which of the local or the other version to keep as the merged version.

member.name: F:Mercurial.MergeTools.InternalDump
member.summary: Creates three versions of the files to merge, containing the contents of local, other and base. These files can then be used to perform a merge manually. If the file to be merged is named "a.txt", these files will accordingly be named "a.txt.local", "a.txt.other" and "a.txt.base" and they will be placed in the same directory as "a.txt".

member.name: T:Mercurial.FileState
member.summary: This enum contains possible file states for files reported by the command through the object.

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Unknown
member.summary: The file is not tracked by Mercurial.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code ? (question mark.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Modified
member.summary: The file has been modified, but not yet committed.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code M (upper-case M.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Added
member.summary: The file has been added, but not yet committed.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code A (upper-case A.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Removed
member.summary: The file has been removed, but not yet committed.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code R (upper-case R.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Clean
member.summary: The file is clean (tracked, no changes detected.)
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code C (upper-case C.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Missing
member.summary: The file is missing, but not marked as removed.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code ! (exclamation mark.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileState.Ignored
member.summary: The file is ignored.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the status code I (upper-case I.)

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force execution even if the source repository is unrelated.

member.summary: Gets the collection of revisions to include from the . If empty, include all changes. Default is empty.

member.name: P:Mercurial.IncomingCommand.BundleFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to and name of the file to store the bundles into. If you intend to pull from the same source with the same parameters after executing "incoming", you should store the bundle locally to avoid the network download twice.

member.summary: Gets all the arguments to the , or an empty array if there are none.

member.name: P:Mercurial.IncomingCommand.Result
member.summary: Gets the result of executing the command as a collection of objects.

member.name: T:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes
member.summary: This enum is used by to specify what kind of status codes to include.

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Modified
member.summary: Include only files that have been modified (that has the status code 'M'.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Added
member.summary: Include only files that have been added (that has the status code 'A'.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Removed
member.summary: Include only files that have been removed (that has the status code 'R'.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Missing
member.summary: Include only files that are missing (that has the status code '!', which means the file is missing on disk, but Mercurial has not been told to remove/forget the file.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Clean
member.summary: Include only clean files without changes (that has the status code 'C'.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Unknown
member.summary: Include only unknown files (that has the status code '?', which means the file is on disk, but Mercurial has not been told to ignore it nor track it.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Ignored
member.summary: Include only ignored files (that has the status code 'I'.)

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.All
member.summary: Include all states.

member.name: F:Mercurial.FileStatusIncludes.Default
member.summary: The default inclusion options, which is everything except ignored and clean (unmodified) files.
